docs.text: on june 30 , 1960 , a self-taught , idealistic , yet pragmatic , young man became , at age 36 , the first head of government of a newly independent african state , formerly the belgian congo .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: two months later , he was ousted from his powerful position and hunted by government troops until he was captured and brutally murdered along with two aides .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this little-known story of this meteoric rise and fall is told my international filmmaker raoul peck in " lumumba . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: patrice lumumba's ( eriq ebouaney ) story has been told previously by helmer peck in his 1991 award winning documentary , " lumumba - death of a prophet , " virtually guaranteeing that his new , fictional account of a patriot remains true to its subject .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: peck , with co-writer pascal bonitzer , begins at the end of the story of the young political leader .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we watch as two white men perform the gruesome task of dismembering the bodies of three black men .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: images of hatchets , saws and fast-emptying whiskey bottles accompany the grisly image .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jump back a few years to a meeting among the black leaders in the belgian-owned congo .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a third class postal worker , lumumba , speaks his mind to heads of the most powerful tribes , proclaiming himself not tribal , not regional , but a national leader .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his small , mobile party , the congolese national movement ( mnc ) is gaining prominence and patrice leaves his clerical job to sell beer , and get his face known , in the bustling capital , stanleyville .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at a time when the colonial empires are falling down around the world , lumumba is in the right place at the right time and , through political savvy and chess-like manipulation , achieves a position of leadership of the mnc .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as the date for independence approaches , he tactically positions himself to be the new nation's first prime minister and defense minister , supporting the presidency of joseph kasa vubu ( maka kotto ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the coalition he created soon starts to fall apart as the former belgian masters continue to exert influence on the struggling nation as they strive to maintain economic hold on the country's vast natural resources of copper , diamonds , gold and more .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: lumumba won't seek the help of the us , knowing that they would try to create de facto american control of the fledgling government .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his initial investigation into soviet assistance immediately tags patrice as a communist and his integrity is overshadowed by the cold war threat of russian domination .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the situation goes from bad to worse as the army mutinies , the remaining whites begin to evacuate or arm themselves , belgian troops violently intervene , the lucrative katanga province succeeds under the leadership of rival moise tschombe ( pascal nzonzi ) and lumumba is refused access to his own country when he returns from a conference abroad .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this tumultuous and little known period of modern african history saw a score of nations struggling for independence from the sometimes-odious colonialists who have ruled much of the world from their european seats of power for centuries .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: peck focuses his story on familiar material that strives to give an honest portrayal of patrice lumumba , his friend and foes and the independence movements that gripped africa in the 50's and 60's .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( during the time the story takes place , many new nations , including nigeria and somalia , were born , with varying degrees of success and failure , usually dependent upon which country colonized them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some colonial masters were better than others . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the effort involved in " lumumba " is quite ambitious as peck and his crew before and behind the camera strive to bring to life this slice of world history that might have gone unexplored for decades , if at all .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: production values are first rate on what must be a small , by us standards , budget .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the period feel and realistic african settings are nicely maintained in a production that traveled from zimbabwe to mozambique .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the screenplay covers a lot of ground and does yeoman's work in providing a great deal of detailed history while trying to do justice to the story of lumumba's life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the political side of things is evenly told in a linear , straightforward manner that teaches , not preaches .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it concentrates on the good deeds of the man , if a bit as a stalwart saint , but doesn't embellish on a larger than life persona .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the family side of patrice's life is handled in several , perfunctory and brief interludes that show him talking to one of his children , embracing his wife or lamenting the death of his child .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i know the intent is to flesh the man out , but too short a shrift is given to the family man side of lumumba .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story , as such , has a lopsided feel about it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: high marks go to eriq ebouaney as the title character .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the actor gives a convincing , charismatic performance as the multifaceted , politically deft patrice lumumba who has the good of his people and his country as the force driving his own ambitions .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in true docudrama tradition , the supporting cast does not outshine the star , complementing his good efforts , instead .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " lumumba " is a solid , interesting , educational and honest docudrama that should appeal to film buffs and politicos , both .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it has more intelligence in its telling than anything i've seen out of hollywood for months and i give it a b+ .
docs.label: positive
